<I think part of the reason I don't use it everyday is that we have
a "grateful wall" in our house and we use that instead. I blogged
about our wall if your interested: http://tinyurl.com/pxgmf>

Thanks for sharing that, Joanne. What a wonderfully simple and unique
idea. You've got me thinking, "Where could we work one of those into
our home? Hmmm..."

Tina

sorry you fell off the WWW but we're glad your back :)

Lesa

"Conformity is the jailer of freedom and the enemy of growth."
-John F. Kennedy

-------Original Message-------

From: Tina
Date: 05/31/06 07:54:22
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] I didn't fall off the earth...

...I fell off the World Wide Web. :-) You may not even remember, but
we had a descent thread going about three weeks ago. Then, I got a
worm on my computer, so I never really got to get into the topic too
far. Thanks for those that replied.

I am reading 'Simple Abundance again'. I am listening to 'Women Who
Run With the Wolves'. Most importantly, I am enjoying the journey a
little more relaxed. Now, if only my husband could do the same. :)

I'm going to try to go back and get up to speed on all the posts. I'm
still having some Internet issues, but I hope to have them resolved
VERY soon. I've felt SO out of touch...

VERY Glad to be Back - Tina

messages.subject: Re: I didn't fall off the earth...
messages.msgSnippet: Tina, What I like about it is there are only 5 lines for each date, so I can write an entry in a few minutes and I don t feel like I have to set aside a lot of
messages.messageBody:
Tina,

What I like about it is there are only 5 lines for each date, so I can
write an entry in a few minutes and I don't feel like I have to set
aside a lot of time to do it.
There are also scattered quotes throughout also. Here's one I like:
"I awoke this morning with devout thanksgiving for my friends, the old
and the new" -Ralph Waldpo Emerson.
I don't use it everyday. I use it when I feel like. I just open to that
date and write something I am grateful for. I think part of the reason
I don't use it everyday is that we have a "grateful wall" in our house
and we use that instead.
I blogged about our wall if your interested:
http://tinyurl.com/pxgmf

~ Joanne ~
Mom to Jacqueline (7), Shawna (10) & Cimion (13)
Adopted into our hearts October 30, 2003
http://anunschoolinglife.blogspot.com/
http://foreverparents.com




--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Tina" <zoocrew@...> wrote:
>
> < Would you believe I bought it in a thrift store (in new condition)
> for fifty cents??? I also have the Simple Abundance journal which
> helps me go back and see where I've been.>
>
> What a bargain! I just LOVE finds like that. What do you think of
> the journal? I've been tempted by it a couple of times, but I have
> been unable to actually look at the inside. Did you like using it?
> Can you tell me anything about the way it's designed?
>
> Thanks - Tina
>

messages.subject: Re: I didn't fall off the earth...
messages.messageBody:
< Would you believe I bought it in a thrift store (in new condition)
for fifty cents??? I also have the Simple Abundance journal which
helps me go back and see where I've been.>

What a bargain! I just LOVE finds like that. What do you think of
the journal? I've been tempted by it a couple of times, but I have
been unable to actually look at the inside. Did you like using it?
Can you tell me anything about the way it's designed?

Thanks - Tina

messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Tina" <zoocrew@...> wrote:
>>>> I am reading 'Simple Abundance again'.>>>>>

I love that book. Would you believe I bought it in a thrift store (in
new condition) for fifty cents??? I also have the Simple Abundance
journal which helps me go back and see where I've been.

~ Joanne ~
